pros:
1. Potential valuable stock awards
2. Leader in the ride hailing industry in South East Asia. And other growing areas in addition to ride hailing like Food, Express Delivery, Groceries and many more to come.
3. Unicorn startup with a huge market shares.
4. Work that I am doing is directly impacting our customers.
5. Above average base pay for the area.
6. Work-time is flexible, more task driven.
7. Despite being in US, we have CTO, CEO etc visiting quite often from Singapore.
cons:
1. Some projects are cross-sites (although not common) and those requires collaboration across time-zones.
2. Company grew too fast, getting things to market fast is important to grab market shares. Thereby accumulating tech debts.
3. Moving from startup to established company often require some amount of process. Need to define those process.

review_title: Amazing opportunities for personal growth while doing important work
pros:
Once you've established trust with your teammates and managers you will have so many opportunities to be involved in all kinds of projects and to take on all kinds of responsibilities.

The environment here is fast paced and it is definitely only for the strong but in my tenure here, I feel like I've grown and learnt so much. I cannot imagine getting the same kinds of opportunities in any other company.

It doesn't matter that much what your background was before joining Grab, I believe that as long as you are able to demonstrate that you are a smart, reliable, hardworking teammate, doors will open for you.

Grab is the kind of company that will have no problem putting 23/24 year old engineers who have not had any previous working experience in charge of critical projects involving core technology and infrastructure (with oversight from more experienced engineering managers of course), as long as they have demonstrated their abilities during their time with us.
cons: Company culture has shifted pretty dramatically as the company has brought in more investment and more teammates to fuel the growth required. This is not necessarily a bad thing in and of itself, but I do miss the days where there were fewer processes to follow and the team as a whole was more cohesive and dynamic.

pros: The CEO is very charismatic, they always keep us updated with his vision. The scale of company is big, more into corporate rather than a Startup.
cons:
As company who handle millions of bookings daily, they have a good tech stack, but it is still not enough, they need to improve some cluster to improve the performance. It may be a small problem, but it can slow down business process.

Working in a role that bridge tech and business via data is really challenging here. You will face variety of business owner, some of it good, but most of them is not data savvy. You need to be really patients on explain things sometimes hands on to give some excel lessons.

Lack of documentation in tech side. We need to ask around to get things done. When I'm still a newbie, even asking around produce no clear outcome. As time goes by, you will understand where and who you should ask regarding which problem. The OKR is not clear. Not all employees understand what they need to achieve. Then SOP? No SOP here. You need to do things accordingly without SOP.

Then the last thing, as a regional company, lot of gap happening between country and regional side. They need to work on this aspect too, minimize knowledge gap between both parties so we can make better decisions.

review_title: A Great Place to work with Incredible Talent Pool and Visionary Leaders
pros:
- Plethora of opportunities to learn and grow in an extremely fast paced environment
- Amazing leaders with a great vision on serving their best to the SEA and the Grabbers too
- Teams with incredible talent pools, open & positive mindsets and very friendly
- Kudos to the POPs teams hiring such talents and getting them all under one roof
- POPs teams are friendly on the floor and have always been promoting an open, positive and a healthy culture 
- A Great work-life balance and Very Good Employment Benefits catering different age groups and not limiting to insurance and internet. 
- Child care partnership and Grabber Assistance Programs 
- Very good employee engagement programs and innovative surprise events
- Employee Trainings every quarter ensuring everyone is skilled and moves with the same pace. You just need ask for one if there's something missing and you get it.
cons: - Nothing is perfect, but then am glad to see teams starting from POPs (first person you contact for a open position) till the top most exec of the company striving to make it better every day for the SEA and the Grabbers.

review_title: Company has huge potential, big goals and equally good team to succeed
pros:
- It has got one of the best Tech Teams
- CEO is a very genuine and friendly guy, and has big visions for the company
- I work on latest technologies, and can switch to other project/team if I want to, it's flexible.
- I always had something to work on here
- Management is open to suggestions, and change is welcomed
- Everyone is friendly and helpful (follows Grab's principle of Your Problem Is My Problem)

Reasons for that title:
- It's the leading taxi hailing service in South East Asia, everyone else is distant second
- It got the biggest funding of $2.5bn in SEA
- With the pace they're progressing, GrabPay is going to take over the payments market very soon in SEA
cons:
- When I joined here, my first few months were very exhausting as they're growing too fast, so the work is never ending, and they're not able to get so many developers,  although it's totally upto you how much work you can take, it's not forced. 
- Very often products are rolled out very fast to stay ahead in market, so sometimes it take a toll of tech debt
- No big team outing and very less activities outside work
- Esops won't make a difference even if they're not offered

pros: Working with Grab, is not the usual life that I have lived before with my former employers. Here, they value your dedication and willingness to participate in the company's growth, or should I say, the FAMILY's growth. One's strength is being fairly assessed, that you may fall on the right tasks and areas, where you can innovate and develop your existing gifts and even receive new ones. Talking about compensation... Not a thing to question about, with Grab, as long  you're doing your part, with willingness to go extra mile, a great reward always comes at the end of the day.
cons:
Downsides?... Downsides are everywhere, no matter what job or company you are in. For me, it only depends on the person on how he/she sees every situation. If your mind is set to find reasons not to "Grab" your dreams, then you will always find a lot. But if you'll set your heart and spirit right, you'll see challenges as "Opportunities", problems as  "Time to Perform", failures as "Learning Process", and fear as "Time to believe"

Proverbs 12:24 Diligent hands will rule, but laziness ends in forced labor.

job_title: Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner, Seattle Engineering in Seattle, WA
pros:
There is a boundless optimism towards future growth and the mission of the organization. People here feel as if they are contributing in one way or another to the overall sum of good in the world, and that dedication to making the world a better place carries us through days that are both good and bad. 
You will find yourself working with top caliber people with a laser focus and commitment to doing their best work. This is a space where impact can be measured objectively and impact is expected by all.
cons: Very fast pace and growth, expect what are the normal growing pains associated with such growth. They are building out systems and processes to overall increase efficiency. While the current state can be  a source of frustration, the journey and input that each individual has towards improvement keeps us in good spirits and further points to the impact that each individual can make.

review_title: Worked as Payment Operations Exec for 2 years
pros:
- Open environment
- Good employee benefit
- Full of young people
- Work can be fun sometimes
- Good salary for fresh grad
cons:
- Grab has no internal communication between departments. Front line agents always do not get updates that they need 

- Process is not align within departments

- Huge ego in between departments as most of the management are young, everyone wants to prove that they are better and this effects the front line agents

- Micro manage in call center departments which makes a lot of the staffs stress

- New products often being launch without having a proper process and SOP

- Grab is known for restructuring departments. First joined as a GrabPay and now suddenly im in Customer Service

- Voices and feedback are not being heard

pros: Good place to help Southeast Asia with traffic
cons:
Company wants people to work like startup with no money, but then has all bureaucracy of big old American company. Projects take forever and internal development is very often blocked because servers broken. Every feature takes many times too long because teams not communicate and write features together.

Seattle office has long hours. Have to work normal hours and then work many hours in the evening to talk to Singapore for good career. If not decisions made without you and you have to redo work. 

Seattle leadership only say “yes right” or “ we will see”. Never listen to feedback or make changes.

Office is not diverse. Look around and see if you interview. Nobody talks to others in office and feels very  isolated outside of team.

review_title: It's a very nice company with shiny future.  I recommend if anyone to work here.

review_title: Grab: A Home for a Millennial Like Me
job_title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator in Makati City
pros: I was a fresh graduate back then when I joined Grab. Just like any millennial, I was looking for a company that has a great culture and has a relevant contribution to the community. Grab is a great employer and here are some of the reasons why: 1) Grab puts great emphasis not only on the hunger or drive one puts forth in one’s work, but also on how one practices honour and humility despite atrocities and still have a heart to serve others – one of our missions is improving the lives of our partners – Grab does this by empowering our driver partners to help them earn a living and offering their wives livelihood projects (plus a lot more); 2) Grab is diverse and inclusive – we employ regardless of sex, age, race, religion, status, etc. As an LGBT ally, I am happy to share that we have a gender-friendly restroom! There are so many more things I have yet to share if you come join us, so please do!
cons: not applicable as of now

pros: Work that can be very meaningful as they have a very real impact in SEA. Opportunities to travel to region to understand and see the product.
cons: Staging server and deployment story in general is a mess. On call is harsh.  HR (People Ops) in Seattle not effective. HR policies all-in-all not great. Last performance review had so many flaws in it. Still undergoing plenty of growing pains, and there's plenty of mess.  Timezone differences with Asia means lots of late night calls. Even on days with no calls, you're either blocked on them or you have to do late night work to unblock them. CTO, effectively leader of engineering, doesn't inspire  - very typical, run-of-the-mill exec, with no standout strength, in spite of his pedigree.

pros:
- awesome family culture
- talented and hard working hires
- initiatives are  heard, no need to pull ranks
- good infrastructure that supports working remotely
cons:
- long work hours and weekends are used (depending on target)
- org chart isnt clear (confusing placement and direct reports recipient especially for new hires)
- at my current office, there isnt a system in place to make sure that everyone is on time like a fingerprint or biometric scanner so some employees still arrive later than their work time

pros: If you are a self starter and love to make things happen then you will be happy at Grab.  In contrast to many companies of Grab size, it really is still a startup.  There is no intransigent bureaucracy, you can make your own "executive" decisions :-) and ask for forgiveness later (if needed).  Erroring on the side of action is appreciated here. The target market is different than what most folks are use to in the US.  It helps to keep an open mind and be ready to re-eval any assumptions you might have about consumer habits, usability, etc.  And it helps to experience it for yourself.  There is nothing like going and visiting Jakarta and other places and trying out the product, if you like on the back of a Grab motorcycle!
cons: Grab processes and corp structure are still evolving and I would say very much work in progress.   The rate of this change is probably not for everyone.

review_title: It is nice to work in this company who has exhibited tremendous growth but the company cultural stinks.
pros:
- interesting and challenging work
- free lunch
- opportunity to work with some very talented people
- never stop growing
cons:
- don’t make time for team building or relationship building outside the office
- hiring new employees rather than investing in existing employees
- pay less attention to the existing employees

review_title: Operation Managers are just a dummy puppet while the Management are their God's
job_title: Singapore Customer Experience Specialist in Damansara
pros: Nothing much as all the perks are meant to make you stay as a slaves.
cons: I got an awards recently prior to my confirmation called "STAR AGENT". This awards refer to the best outserve agents for Singapore Customer Experience Specialist Departments. Unfortunately, i was not made confirm. And the results were blindly based on the number of MC's i've taken. Well this transparently proven that Grab do not appreciate talents. They'll kill talents and make talented people hide in the dark. Honestly, you will never grow in this company. In fact, the only way for you to grow and be at the top management in Grab is to lick someone elses leg. Pardon my languange, i appreciate the moment that i have with Grab, but not anything to do with the managements.

job_title: Driver Retention Specialist in Cebu City
pros: work is challenging.  every day is not the same, you get different issues and that it requires you to be on top of everything.  because of its nature of a tech industry, change is inevitable and you get to be at the forefront of change.
cons: work is sometimes overwhelming due to split-second decisions from the management and launch of new features and products.  you need to be disciplined and to stay focused to stay on top of work issues as well as balance work and personal life. CE needs to be improved.

pros:
- Feels good to change people's life through technologies and you can see how your work affects users. 
- Great talents to work with and willing to share their knowledge. 
- Great dynamic among teams
- Free lunch is awesome
- Happy hour (unlimited booze) every Friday evening
- Provide very good tools for engineers; hardware, for development and even smart phones if you're on Mobile Team
cons:
- Expense claims process is horrible and counter productive 
- Tech MY office too crowded 
- Chairs could be better
- Internet connection in Tech MY office is slow most of the time and would get disconnected.

pros: Free lunches are good. Lady running the cafe is very nice.
cons:
Office is too small. People are cramped together. We're moving offices soon to a bigger space but that has been delayed too many times. Cardboard boxes are everywhere, making it feel v run down and messy. Parking is a nightmare. 

Too many people are being hired without consideration of culture or atmosphere. Makes it hard for newbies to integrate. Too much office politics, too little support. Most unfortunately very little passion comes through, and people can be very unfriendly.

review_title: Unless you like working 70+ hours a week in a dead-end job, don't work here
pros:
Compensation

Health benefits

Friendly, supportive HR team
cons:
Clear bias in hiring. If you interview, look around the office and you'll see what I mean.

Site leadership is not strong

Work / life balance, you need to work full days in Seattle then most nights (to talk to Singapore) to get anything done

Sterile office environment

No path for career progression, unless the site leader likes you

pros: GRAB is a very  innovative, fast-paced company.  Making things possible for the riding public and a great support for peers, taxi operators and drivers in various dynamic platforms.   It offers a lot of challenges and I must say there are no two days alike in this company.  It has a great team that challenges each other and brings out the best in you. The job is fun, creative, meaningful and challenging in all the right ways.
cons: GRAB  has  a very fast-paced and there are times it felt very  overwhelming.   It takes a lot of discipline to be able to balance work and one's personal life.  It is important to take a breather every now and then as one delves into work.

pros: Fit well for people who love working in dynamic environment. Awesome pool of co-workers - very talented, yet humble and passionate about the mission. Lots of opportunities for internal transfer to new roles or new business lines. Decent benefits to its employees (not as high as other big firms - Google, FB).
cons:
- The firm believes in hiring external talents to management positions, leaving little space for internal team members to move up. 
- Challenging to manage communication and alignment as the size of teams involved is only getting bigger. To reach decision making can be tough due to the "flat" organization structure & democratic environment
- No longer a start-up where things move fast and iterates but leaning toward corporation structure. 
- Not recommend for inexperienced folks to work here right after graduate (people are basically too busy and do not have time to train you)

review_title: Great outlook, but still very immature for an organization with ambitions to grow significantly...
pros:
Company is ascendant and has great outlook. The market opportunities are really solid compared to many other startups. Senior leadership is (in my opinion) really pro-active and competent in growing the business.

There's quite a bit of mess though, but mess represents opportunities to have a big impact, so long as you can come to terms with that. The corollary is that you reasonably can expect to have better (i.e. easier) opportunities to have a larger impact than some of the more mature tech companies in Seattle.

Founders are truly passionate, and do take concrete action in trying to create a good culture.
cons:
Grab has been suffering from relatively high turnover and attrition. While building an enduring engineering organization is one of the OKRs, but I've seen very little attention given by upper management and concrete plans communicated on what steps the organization is taking towards this. All the oxygen is spent on outcompeting in our strategic markets, growing the business, or keeping our service up. 

So... amongst other things, forget about any sort of training on things like ethics and compliance, diversity and inclusion. It results in situations such as there being (large) teams in Seattle which suffer from extreme homogeneity in race/country-of-origin... and where if you're not a member of this race, you're part of the out-group... 

... and unfortunately, being part of the out-group has very real repercussions beyond the social aspects...

pros: 1. Better work/life balance and quality work
cons:
1. Broken organization structure. Teams contain 40 backend engineers,5 mobile and 5 QA, 10 product managers, 1 designer and 1 TPM which is just not sustainable.No tech architects present.
2. Very toxic culture. I am a manager of a team of 5 and my manager had 5 teams under him. He made sure to keep me blindsided in performance managements and team budgets. I was deliberately excluded from team meetings and team outings
3. Indifferent management and HR who is in bed with the management, so if you have a problem with the management, going to the HR is just useless.
4. Incompetent and arrogant product managers. PMs do not come up with a feature for the betterment of the product but only to improve his/her resume.
5. Company strategy changes every six months which leads to lots of confusion.
6. Lots of internal disparity in salaries and HR is happy ignoring it. 
7. Insular culture, people do not care.

pros:
- Great $$ potential
  * company features as ~14h highest valued "unicorn" tech company -- over USD10B
  * lots of "untapped" markets -- various markets and products to expand to
- Genuine focus on the customer and on improving communities
- Management is actively attempting to fix outside SG trust and bureaucracy issues
cons:
- Working with headquarters in Asia is tough (US <= +15h => SG)
  * management is far away
  * key stakeholders and deciders also far away -- work goes slower
  * lots of meetings outside my 9-5 (but flexible to arrive late next day)
- Dev-to-Prod cycle is way more painful than necessary (bureaucracy & trust)

review_title: Easily the best company I have worked with!
pros: Exceptional opportunities for career growth. A definite feeling of contribution to the company. The HR is quite possibly the best I've experienced in India; they really make a big difference to the culture here. Another important factor is that most of the people here are really talented, motivated people. This makes for a great environment at work. Pay is pretty great too :)
cons: No complaints. I guess healthier food as snacks? Heh.

review_title: Great Vision, But Still So Many Challenges in terms of Culture and Process
pros:
Great vision to help transportation in SEA
Most of the people are great to work with
Still has a bit of the startup vibe where communication is more open
Instills great passion and sense of challenge
Never a boring day at Grab
cons:
Structures and processes are still very rough or not established at all
As an effect of growing pains, company is starting to feel bureaucratic
Some of the new upper managers have their own way of working which may negatively affect company culture
Can be painfully understaffed and slow to hire, which affects employee performance negatively

review_title: Low pay, high workload, broken promises
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Seattle, WA
pros: For some time we had good autonomy and  shipping useful products.
cons: Raises are low to zero, stock price hasn't changed in 2 years, managers expect you to be butt in seat 9-7 every day. Grab is run like a Chinese company, not an American tech company. They will work you hard and tell you you are blessed to have a job. Leadership is not transparent. So many people joined 1.5 years ago have all gone, pushed out or so tired of management they left. Diversity is a joke, if you're the wrong person on the wrong team, watch your back. Mobile builds take 45 min, and somehow they want you to be able to code fast.

pros:
- You get to work on the latest technologies with latest tools.
- Good scope of learning.
- People are very friendly here, most of them are always happy to help you.
- You get to write the services almost from scratch as the code base is pretty new in India.
cons:
- Devops team is a bit bottleneck , sometimes it becomes frustrating as you need their approval for every small thing and more often than not it takes up more time than the actual development.
- HR activities are quite less, mostly it's all about your work.
- No company sponsored lunch.
- Tax structure not up to the mark.

job_title: Customer Experience Associate in Manila, Manila
pros: I like the the generosity of the company to their employees. Grab is giving what the employees deserve for the hard work. The benefits and incentives. The friendly environment and the management. The people around me that will make you feel like you're not stress despite of the workload.
cons: Please be more considerate of others when it comes to application.  Even though the applicant failed or there must have been misunderstanding on the communication part. Please still consider them. I just wanted to brought up the people who still wants to re apply to grab and as per HR or management they can no longer to apply to grab anymore.  Please give chance and be considerate to others. Thanks!

pros:
Grab has its brand name
Huge customer base
Very good product
Can use advanced technologies
Flexible environment
Not too much work pressure
cons:
Grab India R&D centre lacks facilities, culture, and benefits as compared to any other Grab R&D centre. 
Always talk about less budget, cost cutting etc.
Doesn't feel like working in a big company in terms of facilities/options they provide.

pros: Company grows very fast and there are some great opportunities to make impacts.
cons:
Seattle team grows very fast but the process of ramping up is not good. In some cases, people are even counter-productive due to the increased bureaucracy, amateur code and rounds of rounds of code reviews to help them (some has big ego!).  Hiring process is a little casual and there is no consistent bars on hiring people resulting in some "great" and some "not so good" hires. 
There are also rumors from outside sources that new hires get much higher packages than current employees, which is not good for morale.

review_title: Awful work life balance, leadership lack vision
pros: Very intelligent and experienced people to work with
cons:
* No work life balance. After 8 working in US working hours, you have to work 2-4 hours in Singapore time (if you want to be successful in Grab)

* US office is a satellite office and all major decision are taken in Singapore.

* Local management has no interest in sharing roadmap or overall vision.

* No career growth opportunities.

* Leadership does not care about feedback

review_title: What happens behind modern transport revolution?
job_title: Senior Business Development Manager in Jakarta
pros:
A very fast moving company, a great place to learn and contribute to the development of digital revolution in SEA. Management demands high responsibility due to impossible company's objective. 

Opportunity to grow exponentially in terms of career progression and self development. Ability to witness real results once an initiative is implemented to the market.
cons: Workload can be very stressful. Sometimes it is necessary to stand by 24/7 especially during holiday.

review_title: Best Company but Cust-serv Management sucks
pros: Best CEO,Free Food,Good Salary,cool working envoirment,fun working mate, best benefits
cons: Talent doesn't work here,you have to butter people if you want to stay long.

pros: High potential for the company and an individual. With the internal growth, there are a lot of opportunities to move up or to another division.
cons: Some growing pains but the heart is in the right place. In the process of building internal procedures and systems so be patient.

pros:
Enthusiastic payment support professional with 1 and 1/2 years of experience working as a liaison between consumers and corporations. Skilled communicator and listener with a knack for remedying conflict, and keen organizational skills which allow for effective delivery of outstanding service. Maintain
the highest level of integrity; dedicated to providing reliable and friendly service without ever compromising the reputation or competencies of the organization. Highly motivated and outgoing individual with current role experienceand three years of management experience with Citigroup.

Competent team player who can successfully inspire fellow colleagues.
cons: Worklife balance due to work requirement

review_title: Good Place to Learn End-to-End and Exercise Grit but Gets Tougher & Tougher
pros:
1. Everyday is a learning experience to business success and personal growth
2. No strict dress code.
cons:
1. People were more collaborative/creative when there was still competition 
2. All wanna do everything all at the same time.  Alignment of priorities.
3. Compensation need to be improved/re-aligned to market
4. Employee Compensation quite disarrayed after the merger.

job_title: Costumer Service Associate in Manila, Manila
pros:
Grab has a good working environment, aside from that the people that surrounds you are very friendly and approachable.

Here in Grab you can see the dedication in every department and team, their handwork and willingness to do their job for the future progress of the company.

Lastly, you will learn a lot of things and knowledge that will enhance you as an individual employee.
cons: The transportation allowance should be converted either into cash or Grabpay credits, to make it less hassle and convenient to every employee.

pros: So far I've been enjoying my stay here and the training has been going well as well as everyone being friendly. all the way from the people up up to my peers. even the guards themselves are approachable and friendly
cons: As of the moment I have nothing to say about this as I've only been with the company for less than 2 weeks

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: Products and services made/make real major impacts on lives and societies in Southeast Asia.   Lots of strong engineering leaders and managers globally to share and learn from.   Technologies we are using are new and exciting (Go, React, Machine Learning, ...) .  Team members are friendly and professional toward each other.
cons: Products and services need to be at 24x7 highest quality.  Lots of careful testing, planning involved on every feature.  Sometimes, the release cycles are slower than expected from customers.

job_title: Customer Experience Specialist in Makati City
pros: The company knows how to party. They have a lot of employee engagements which makes the employee feel of working and having fun at the same time.  I really love the welcome kit and the Grab Driver Experience, where new hires gets the chance to experience as a Grab driver. The interaction between the driver and passenger really helps the new hires to understand the culture of Grab.
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

job_title: Head of PartnerAcquisition in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
1) Fast moving environment. Fully accountable and fully empowered to make a difference 
2) Open , strong commitment to help and support each others from all verticals 
3) You learn to build something from scratch and nurture it
cons:
1) Becomes too big too fast, will need to spend lots of efforts to build sustainability 
2) Process will have to be put in place

review_title: Responds to customers (drivers, operators and passengers) thru email
job_title: Customer Service Associate in Makati City
pros: You will get a chance to be part of a very promising and young organization that has a very positive outlook on their purpose and on how they do business
cons: can somehow be a risk working here because the company is still growing. however, if we look in to the trend from the time the company started, it gives you an impression that it is something that would last forever

job_title: Customer Service Associate in Makati City
pros: Grab is the right company to build a stable career. People are properly trained and fun to be with.
cons: As of the moment, I'm not seeing much of the  downside part of Grab, since it's still the training period. Everything is going fine. I think It just need a little improvement with some of the facilities.

job_title: Quality Control Analyst in Manila, Manila
pros: Employees get to interact with other departments and regions that can enhance professional and personal skills and flexible work hours. With great benefits and perks to employees.
cons: With nature of work, there are certain limitations on access that might cause delay on deliverable due to dependency to other groups that will provide data or reports.

pros:
- Strong and positive working culture
- Dynamic decision, planning and execution
- Good benefit (compensable commuting cost, free uniform, etc.)
cons:
- Hard work, multi-tasking
- Short lead time
- Small office (in Bangkok, but moving to other buliding soon)

job_title: Customer Service Associate in Makati City
pros: Grab is a growing and promising company and I want to be a part of it.  People are all nice and friendly starting from the lowest positon up to the highest  position. I believe that in Grab you will have a good future and a stable job as well.
cons: I am new in this company and I don't see any downsides of working at Grab.  I believe that in the future Grab will give all the best for his/her employees.

review_title: Grab, Most happening and well funded startup, expanding at great speed.
pros:
1. Work life balance 
2. Great opportunity to learn and hands on experience particularly for engineers 
3. Good office
4. Insurance for family 
5. Free soft drinks & snacks (No free lunch)
cons:
1. Unfortunately Payroll management is an upset

2. POP-S tar team is full of actors and politicians (Manager leads from front).

pros:
-People at regional level makes everything exciting for me.
-Good benefits - except I still don't have my HMO card (maybe due to the lockdown situation)
-Flexible working hours.
-No dramas, just yes and no and "here's what you can do" type of conversation.
cons: Something Grab should work on is how to keep employees with a positive mindset.

job_title: Quality Assurance Analyst in Manila, Manila
pros: I like the generosity of GRAB in providing us the salaries we deserve and also the health card for all employees and the GRAB and communication allowance.
cons: I hope we could provide health card for our dependents asap for the security of all employees. And that our GRAB and communication allowance be added in our GRAB pay.

pros:
I feel people here are very positive working on great products tirelessly. I love working here. HRs are very helpful and all the processes in the company are very transparent, Flexible working hours and a good work life balance is promoted. 
huge learning opportunities.
cons: Communicating with a distributed team is not organised enough.

review_title: There is a huge chance of showcasing your full potential.
pros: There is a huge chance of showcasing your full potential and be promoted.
cons: Since it is a start up company in a very fast pacing industry. It may require a lot of patience and fast grasp of ideas and information. You need to be innovative the faster way you can.

pros: Fast paced and growing rapidly which opens more opportunity, with very Flexible working hours and work from home policies.
cons: A lot of Organizational structure changes. Lack of work-life balance task never ends. Data are all over the place. Making decisions takes a while and there are cases that it is based on a popular vote than numerical data. Lots of time required after hours.

job_title: Vendor Management Org Specialist in Jakarta
pros: It's a prestige to work at Grab as we also help people to earn income for their live. And the environment is very dynamic and fun
cons: There are hiccups on the internal SOP as Grab grows so fast and perhaps didn't have enough time to prepare and catch up with the organization grow.

review_title: High impact work, great people, lots to learn
pros:
- Many seasoned engineers and managers, lots to learn
- No bureaucracy  
- Flexible working hours, and absolutely no micro management. 
- Everyone is very helpful. "Your problem is my problem" is one of the core principles of the company, and is followed across the company.
cons: - Seattle/Bellevue is a R&D center, but business is in SEA.

pros: One of the fastest growing tech startup in south east asia. Good employer branding. Team are pretty young and of diverse background.
cons: Employees whom have high visibility and right networking with senior management gets a lot of credit. Business support is oftentimes lacking from data team.

pros: The Environment at Grab really feels like you are part of the Family. They treat you with respect and they are very hospitable most specially to the new employee of the company. Grab provides good benefits for their employee.
cons: In regards with the Transportation allowance should be converted to cash or Grab Credits.

pros: Working in Grab helps develop my skills and enhance my abilities, and most of all it changes my life.
cons: What I can see as con is when there are times that I want to take my leave, I can't take it because of call of duty and as Grab Principles wherein we should prioritize Grab Before Self, I need to do my duty and responsibilities to contribute with the company.

job_title: Customer Experience Specialist in Makati City
pros: Every bit of this company is superb! I am confident to say that my future will be secured and be bright.
cons: So far there is none. But if ever there is any, I'm sure that Grab will do there best to improve any of it.

pros: Grab car can change the life of the taxi drivers and keep the costs of travel within Klang Valley lower, thus encouraging more people to go that way, rather than driving their own cars in already congested KV with limited parking places.
cons: Their are too many drivers compare to passengers. This driving is one of the few service jobs that doesn't allow tips.

job_title: Quality Control Supervisor in Manila, Manila
pros: I love the work environment. I love that my job challenges me every day in different ways.
cons: Some co worker desire to outshine the rest

pros: New technologies, flexible, good engineer culture, nice manager
cons: Growing too fast, but lots of processes are not matured. Lack of career development. You are expected to work very hard, on call is very challenging

pros: very challenging, you will encounter different situations everyday. you must always think of something that will make you more competitive than the other players!
cons: being a start up company there is still a lot of improvements needed in the internal operations especially alignment between departments.

job_title: Data Processing in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
. Grab have friendly environment, serving culture
. Beautiful office
cons:
. it is very large now, it is hard for you to have real impact
. because of it size, there are some inefficiency here and there. I think it is normal for large company like grab.

pros:
The place provides transparency and has developed a good culture of values, a nice working environment.
The team members are great and is always willing to give their time and support for the opposite person to sync in and learn.
cons: Everything looks good but there is scope of further betterment.

pros: The benefits of the company are quite good, with free lunch, allowances and holidays. The people in Grab are great, helpful and friendly.
cons: Sometimes, you don't really get recognized for the things that you do.  It becomes just a number on a chart. And, you get a pat on your back.

job_title: Customer Experience Associate in Manila, Manila
pros: Grab employees treat each other as family. There is always a room for improvement and learning. There is a continuous growth within the company.
cons: You need to keep up with the fast-pace environment, but come to think of it, it is actually beneficial to everyone in the long run.

pros: Gain experience working on fast paced and startup envinronment
cons: Career development is unclear and unstable

job_title: Talent Acquisition Business Partner in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
- Excellent organizational leadership, passion, and culture
- Great learning environment, exposure to a lot of varying opportunities
- Rapidly changing environment, fast paced, and interesting place to work
- Tons of opportunities of growth and if you perform well, you're treated well in terms of bonus and comp
cons: - Long hours depending on your project

pros:
Excellent management team. Everyone is so friendly and I have yet to see a frowning face!
Career growth.
cons:
HMO could be better. Hopefully you will also provide one for the dependents soon.
Make it convenient for all employees and hire a full time concessionaire.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: Fast pace, practical approach, flexible working schedule, young and dynamic team. Politics is not developed to complicated level.
cons: Focuses and objectives are changed quite fast. Change management is not well developed.

pros:
Plenty of opportunities to within the company, managers are open to train up their employees
Family-like culture 
Casual dress code
cons:
High stress, lots of pressure to move quick
Decisions can be made impromptu

Company politics

pros:

pros: Focused on growth and serving in SEA. Learned co-workers. Especially in data science and engineering, we get to learn a lot from experienced people.
cons: Too many meetings sometimes, which takes some time and focus off actual work.

review_title: A Singaporean company with offices all over the world to support them!
pros: A decent stepping stone for young people looking to get into tech.
cons:
Staff in country offices are only seen as servicing resources and there is little to no interest in seeing them as more than that.

Favouritism is rampant.

No accountability for lack of process.

job_title: Managing Director in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: Real, huge impact to SEA. Learned and grew a lot here. Great leaders. Friendly working environment. The company is big but still agile.
cons: Org structure keeps changing due to changing needs. But that’s ok as it’s normal for startups. Change management is a bit challenging.

review_title: Friendly and active environment to work in

pros: People here are very supportive and nice. They help you to their best whenever you share any problem with them. The benefits are good and the compensation/saraly is worth your contribution.
cons: The pressure is quite high. You must be very adaptable to changes and positive to all kinds of pressure.

pros:
Great working environment.

Open door policy

pros: Diverse, intellectual rigor, strong and diverse culture.  High impact teams who are extremely sharp.  The office has amazing views of the Puget Sound and Lake Washington.  Makes coming to work every day enjoyable.
